title: Inference
text: Motivating Example

title: Inference
text: Adding a Box Plot

title: Inference
text:
Linear Model


Code
res <- penguins %>% lm(body_mass_kg ~ species, data = .)
res


#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = body_mass_kg ~ species, data = .)
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>      (Intercept)  speciesChinstrap     speciesGentoo  
#>          3.70616           0.02692           1.38627

title: Inference
section: Are the Means from each species different? Or is it due to random chance?
text: Are the Means from each species different? Or is it due to random chance?

title: Inference
text:
Inference
The process to determine if an estimate of a parameter is valuable or just due to random chance.

title: Inference
text:
Randomness of Data


Code
penguins %>% gf_jitter(shuffle(body_mass_kg) ~ species) %>%
  gf_theme(theme_bw()) %>%
  gf_labs(x = "Quarter Mile Time", y = "MPG") %>%
  gf_theme(axis.title = element_text(size = 24))

title: Inference
text:
Empirical vs Shuffled

  ðŸŸ¡ Loading
    webR...

title: Inference
text:
Repeat it 1000


Code
f_sim <- do(1000) * f(shuffle(mpg) ~ qsec, 
                         data = mtcars)
pre_sim <- do(1000) * pre(shuffle(mpg) ~ qsec, 
                         data = mtcars)

title: Inference
text:
Distribution of PRE
The distribution of \(PRE\) shows all the possible values that \(PRE\) can take with their respective probabilities.

title: Inference
text:
Distribution of PRE


Code
gf_histogram(~pre, data = pre_sim)

title: Inference
text:
Distribution of \(F\)
The distribution of \(F\) shows all the possible values that \(F\) can take with their respective probabilities.

title: Inference
text:
Distribution of \(F\)


Code
gf_histogram(~f, data = f_sim)

title: Inference
text:
Portioning the upper 5% the Distribution


Code
gf_histogram(~f, data = f_sim, fill = ~upper(f, .05))

title: Inference
text:
Where is our observed value?


Code
gf_histogram(~f, data = f_sim, fill = ~upper(f, .05)) %>%
  gf_vline(xintercept = f(res))

title: Inference
text:
P-Value
The p-value tells you what is the probability of observing your \(F\) or something more extreme.

title: Inference
text:
Visually


Code
gf_histogram(~f, data = f_sim, fill = ~ f > f(res)) %>%
  gf_vline(xintercept = f(res))

title: Inference
text:
Computing the p-value
We will count how many simulated \(F\)â€™s are more extreme and divided by the number of simulations plus one.

title: Inference
section: Counting how many Fâ€™s are more extreme
text:
Counting how many Fâ€™s are more extreme


Code
tally(~ f > f(res), data = f_sim)


#> f > f(res)
#>  TRUE FALSE 
#>     0  1000

title: Inference
text:
Computing the p-value


#> TRUE 
#>    0

title: Inference
text:
Mathematical Model
\[
TS = \frac{MSG}{MSE} \sim F(k-1,n-k-1)
\]

title: Inference
text:
P-Value
\[
\mathrm{p} = Pr(TS \ge F)
\]

title: Inference
text:
Letâ€™s have R do it!


#>  Analysis of Variance Table (Type III SS)
#>  Model: body_mass_kg ~ species
#> 
#>                               SS  df     MS       F   PRE     p
#>  ----- --------------- | ------- --- ------ ------- ----- -----
#>  Model (error reduced) | 145.190   2 72.595 341.895 .6745 .0000
#>  Error (from model)    |  70.069 330  0.212                    
#>  ----- --------------- | ------- --- ------ ------- ----- -----
#>  Total (empty model)   | 215.260 332  0.648
